ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Cha
ygData.msgSnippet: wow, stamina must do one HECK of a lot more for real melee then.. My SK  (at level 12) gets more hp than that from +5 stamina.  I think like 20 ... From:
ygData.messageBody:
wow, stamina must do one HECK of a lot more for real melee then.. My SK (at
level 12) gets more hp than that from +5 stamina. I think like 20
----- Original Message -----
From: <kim@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, April 03, 2000 12:13 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Cha


> On Mon, 3 Apr 2000, Kevin L. Crawford wrote:
>
> > Have to agree here. You did fine on your stats. I tend to put
everything
> > in charisma and stamina when I create a Bard. Stamina adds a good
number of
> > hp per level and helps a ton in the long run. And there really aren't
very
>
> ??? I got a belt of concordance last night and took off my
> troll hide belt (which has +5 sta). Going from 75 to 70
> stamina, I lost 15 hp at level 50.
>
> The amount of hp you have is very much like the amount of mana
> you have - both will help in the short term, but neither have
> much effect in the long term. What really matters is your
> hp/mana regeneration rate. The only time extra hp and extra
> mana are useful are in close fights where every little bit
> helps. (That and clerics seem to like extra hp since it gives
> them more time to allocate heals.)
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
